results.title: Fathers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
In Australian society most men become fathers, but how do they know what to do? In this title, men talk about fatherhood and what it means to them, and PGR looks at the father’s role beyond that of the traditional “provider”.

results.title: Discipline 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR Looks at why we discipline our children and the ways we do it, suggesting guidelines for starting the process with young children. Using dramatisations we look at the problem of aggressive behaviour and how to solve it without parents resorting to aggressive behaviour themselves.

results.title: Weaning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines the weaning process, how to start, the possibility of allergies to new foods, the child’s digestive system, and the danger of dental decay.

results.title: Salome. The Forbidden
results.creator_credit: Clive Barker, Redemption and South Bank Show
results.brief_description: In the early 1970’s, Barker made two powerful and disturbing short films which have never been seen before and provide important insights into Barker’s creative process. “Salome”, an 18 min. silent film with soundtrack was made in 1973, starring Anne Taylor, Graham Bickley, Clive Barker, Doug Bradley, Phil Rimmer, Lyn Darnell, Susan Bickley and Julie Blake. “The Forbidden”, a 36 min. silent film with soundtrack was made between 1975-78 and provides glimpses into Hellraiser. It could almost be seen as Hellraiser’s prologue, showing a “puzzle-book” and a skinning and flesh removal sequence. Starring Peter Atkins, Clive Barker, Doug Bradley, Phil Rimmer, Lyn Darnell and Julie Blake. This compilation includes the added bonus of selected interviews with Clive Barker and the casts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clive Barker, Redemption and South Bank Show

It could almost be seen as Hellraiser’s prologue, showing a “puzzle-book” and a skinning and flesh removal sequence. Starring Peter Atkins, Clive Barker, Doug Bradley, Phil Rimmer, Lyn Darnell and Julie Blake. This compilation includes the added bonus of selected interviews with Clive Barker and the casts.

results.title: Physical Disabilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR examines the effects disabilities have on children and their families. One young man whose mother had taken the drug Thalidomide speaks about the effects his disability has had on his life. He has won world records for five of the six events open to armless swimming competitors. He firmly believes anyone can achieve anything they want in life, provided they want it badly enough and are willing to work and persevere in order to achieve their goals. He speaks with sensitivity and humour on the reactions of his peers, his aunt and sister, and his mother, to his disability. His happy and positive nature leaves no doubt he will continue to achieve whatever he sets his mind to.

results.title: Outside Adventures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR presents some of the values and practicalities involved in taking children outside. Sandplay and waterplay are examined, as is the preparation of garden “playscapes”. Gardening is recommended as an outside adventure, and birdwatching in the garden is also discussed. Stories may provide a lead into outdoor activities which exercise both imagination and body. Finally, hints on preparation for a shopping trip and camping expedition in the backyard are provided.
